result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Daniel Toles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Daniel Toles is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Daniel Toles was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

superMiscConds.notes: Fine $1380.50   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. restitution $90.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA surcharge $250.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
To successfully complete cognitive thinking program, absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Sentenced to 6 years prison/ 2 years in custody consecutive to 13 CF 22 Washburn County Case and 4 years extended supervision.  Restituion of $90.00 to Lac Courte Police Department - AODA and any follow thru - to successfully complete cognitive thinking program - fine/costs of $1630.50 - absolute sobriety and eligible for substance abuse program.
Consecutive to: Washburn County Case 13 CF 22

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua Daniel Toles in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Defendant Joshua Daniel Toles in custody.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  8:59 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  
Agreement count 1 - 6 yrs prison - 2yrs in and 4 yrs ES consecutive to any time in Washburn County 13 CF 22 - $90.00 to Lac Coutre Police restitution - AODA - cognitive thinking program - $1630.50 fine/costs and count 2 is dismissed.  Atty Gramstrup agrees as does the defendant.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.  Defendant entered plea of nc to count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty count 1 and dismissed count 2.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Gramstrup argues sentencing.  Defendant addressed the Court.

COURT:  Sentence to 6 years prison - 2 years in custody and 4 years extended supervision consecutive to 13 CF 22 Wash. co. case - restitution of $90.00 to LCO police department - AODA and any follow thru - to successfully complete cognitive thinking program - fine/costs $1630.50 - absolute sobriety - eligible for substance abuse program

Attorney Chris A. Gramstrup in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case.  Atty Gramstrup addressed the court matter has been resolved believes client has been taken to prison.  State agrees a resolution has been reached.  Atty Gramstrup to prepare order to transport  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
